channel.title: [TUT] How to make a client [TUT] VERY detailed
channel.description:
[center]I am aware this has already been posted its just it sank down to page three so i thought i could make my own to help the people who want to make their own client.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
[b][u]Difficult?[/u][/b] 2/10
[b][u]Requirements:[/u][/b] WinRar or some other unpacking program
[b][u]Knowledge needed:[/u][/b] Basic paint knowledge, ability to compile, ability to copy and paste xD
[b][u]Anything else:[/u][/b] not really......
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
[b][u]Getting the client base:[/u][/b]
there are many client base's out today. Here are a few links to get them:
AdvancedScape v1: [url=http://uppit.com/H35I1A]http://uppit.com/H35I1A[/url] RicsClient: [url=http://uppit.com/HN7SQT/url] GoogleScape: [url]http://uppit.com/A2B7ID]http://uppit.com/HN7SQT/url] GoogleScape: [url]http://uppit.com/A2B7ID[/url]
In this TUT i will be using the RicScape client.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
[b][u]Making the Client background:[/u][/b]
Ok, now we can start making our client. To start of with it would be good if we got our own client background, and mabye even sprites if you want to go the one step more.
You can either make your own background image or get one of google images. I'm going to go the quick option and grab one of google images (you may change your client background any time). Ok, my server is called superscape so i'm going to type into google 'superman' [b]{REMEBER, YOUR IMAGE MUST BE QUITE BIG SO IT DOSNT LOSE AS MUCH PIXELS}.[/b] This is the superman image i have chosen: [url=http://writeontheinternet.files.wordpress.com/2007/09/superman.jpg]http://writeontheinternet.files.wordpress.com/2007/09/superman.jpg[/url] as you can see the image is quite big and has room in the middle for the log in box.
Now i need to copy that image, right click it and press 'copy'. Once you have copyied it open up photoshop/GIMP/paint.NET
you can get these from:
[url=http://www.getpaint.net/download.html]http://www.getpaint.net/download.html[/url] (paint.NET) [url=http://www.gimp.org/downloads/]http://www.gimp.org/downloads/[/url] (GIMP) [url=http://www.adobe.com/products/photoshop/index.html]http://www.adobe.com/products/photoshop/index.html[/url] (photoshop)
i suggest GIMP because its free and [b]very[/b] good.
Now that you have opened it up change the abbritutes to 765 by 503 and paste your image into it, [b]MAKE SURE YOU KEEP THAT ABBRITUTE SIZE THE SAME AT ALL TIMES!!!!![/b]
[IMG]http://i29.tinypic.com/2dvsffp.jpg[/img]
Now that you've added your picture you can add text and 'pimp' your client background ;)
When it comes to saving make sure you overwrite the client background that the client owner is already using, for example, for the ricscape client, save the file in the ric_file_store_32 and name it RicScape. You've now done finished your client background, run the client and see! If your image is all flipped you'll need to flip your image, use this tutoriel i made earlyer [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,262175.0.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,262175.0.html[/url] ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
[b][u]Changing the text:[/u][/b]
ok, for starters, go into the frame_sub1 and search for the name of the client. Once you've found it change it to your servers name [b]MAKE SURE YOU KEEP THE CREATORS NAME IN THERE OTHERWISE HE WILL GET YOU DONE FOR LEECHING![/b]
Now open the GUI (if the client has one) and search for the clinet base name and change it to your servers name [b]MAKE SURE YOU KEEP THE CREATORS NAME IN THERE OTHERWISE HE WILL GET YOU DONE FOR LEECHING![/b]
Now open the client.jar and change all the clients name to your servers name again [b]MAKE SURE YOU KEEP THE CREATORS NAME IN THERE OTHERWISE HE WILL GET YOU DONE FOR LEECHING![/b]
Now compile it all togethor and run the client!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
[u][b]Changing the Clients Text Colour:[/b][/u]
(this is optional)
ok, in the clinet.jar you will find little bits of text saying @whi@ or @red@, they stand for the colour so if you wanted to change it to green just make it @gre@
Notice that the colours are always the first three letters of the colour you want to change it too.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
[b][u]Changing the Sprites[/u][/b]
all you have to do is open the sprites folder and edit them using paint.NET/GIMP/photoshop
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ [b][u]How to Change Textures.[/u][/b]
[b][u]1.[/u][/b] Open up Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub3
[b][u]2.[/u][/b] Hit Ctrl + F And Search For [code]public static final int[] method371(int i)[/code]
[b][u]3.[/u][/b] Add This: [code] if (i == #####) { i = %%%%; }[/code]
[b][u]4.[/u][/b] Replace ##### with the texture id you want and replace %%%% with the object id you want! This is adding the object into the client ;)
Here is a useful list made by Scarcrows
[code] * 50 suggests the end of the textures... * 49 = Something to do with 48, I assume * 48 = Hyroglyphs * 47 = Extremely light wall colour * 46 = Ground in varrock by the fountain * 45 = Door * 44 = Similar to 43; Darker * 43 = Buildings' stone wall * 42 = Sold blue * 41 = Bushes of some sort * 40 = Lava * 39 = Painting of an elf * 38 = One of the new Falador textures * 37 = Same as 38 * 36 = Door or floor texture * 35 = New Falador walls * 34 = Magic tree stars * 33 = Maple tree leaves * 32 = Sand * 31 = Another lava overlay * 30 = Yew tree overlays * 29 = Fern Leaves * 28 = ??????? * 27 = Snake skin * 26 = Spider webs * 25 = Water of some sort * 24 = Flowing water * 23 = Dark buidling siding * 22 = Wooden floor * 21 = Roofing * 20 = Book case * 19 = Something with.. holes.. * 18 = Sand * 17 = Water found water * 16 = Wooden roof I think. * 15 = Looks like an overlay for water? * 14 = Portrait of a king * 13 = Landscape of mountains * 12 = Bars on those jail doors, etc * 11 = Runecrafting altar \ mysterious rune texture * 10 = Solid blue * 9 = Tree stumps * 8 = Tree leaves * 7 = Logs * 6 = Red roofing * 5 = Really dark wood texture * 4 = Elven doors * 3 = Wooden flooring * 2 = Stone walls (i.e. on Varrock banks, etc) * 1 = Water * 0 = Door[/code]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
[b][u]A Useful List Of Client Classes [/u][/b] (thanks scarcrow)
[code]Class5 - NPCs
Class8 - Items
Class7 - Object Loading
Class9 - Interfaces
Class16 - Sounds
Class20 - Animations
Class23 - Graphics Importer
Class25 - Worldmap
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2 - Background
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub3 - Textures
Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub6 - Models
Class31 - Packets
Class35 - Text Input
Class44 - Cache
Class45 - Skills
Class46 - Objects
Class48 - Mouse Detection
Class50 - Text [/code]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
[b][u]Changing Loading Bar Colour[/u][/b]
[b][u]1.[/u][/b] Open up your Class30_Sub2_Sub1
[b][u]2.[/u][/b] Hit Ctrl + F And Search For [code]Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method337(c / 2 - 152, 304, 34[/code] under that there should be something like.... Superscape - loading please wait or somthing like that.
[b][u]2.[/u][/b] In my client it says: [code]Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method337(c / 2 - 152, 304, 34, 0xFFFF00, j, true);[/code]
The [i]0xFFFF00[/i] is my colour. Change that to change the loading bar colour.
Get all your colours from here: [url=http://www.w3schools.com/Html/html_colors.asp]http://www.w3schools.com/Html/html_colors.asp[/url]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
[b][u]CREDITS[/u][/b]
client makers me person who created first ever client makes of paint.net/photoshop/GIMP maker of compiler scarecrow[/center]
